intro: Psychotria cutucuana, commonly known as the Amazonian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria cutucuana is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
